elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the following questions using the communication model.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Why should the factual level be in the foreground when criticizing or receiving criticism?
elements.correctAnswer: Criticism on the factual level refers to a certain behavior, work performed, etc. The person themselves and their personality are not the subject of criticism.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Shouldn't the area in front of the entrance be mopped?
elements.correctAnswer: The store manager doesn't want to say directly that the area in front of the entrance is dirty and give the order "Go on, wipe the area!". A good relationship with his employees is important to him, but the dirt in front of the entrance bothers him.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Why do misunderstandings arise?
elements.correctAnswer: Misunderstandings arise when the sender and receiver focus on different levels of communication. Example: The sender makes what she considers to be a factual comment, but the receiver hears it primarily with the relational ear and thus understands it as criticism of her person.

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: List five rules that can help you avoid misunderstandings.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Rule 1
elements.correctAnswer: The sender must not assume that he will be understood by the recipient.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Rule 2
elements.correctAnswer: The sender must communicate clearly and unambiguously.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Rule 3
elements.correctAnswer: The broadcaster should repeat things that are important.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Rule 4
elements.correctAnswer: The recipient should pay attention to the body language of the sender.
